website_summaries.verdict: Minor concerns aside, this windshield cover has features that top competitors, including a durable build and easy-to-use attachment system that makes it practical for all weather conditions.
pros: Stands up to all types of weather, as it's constructed from durable polyester with a heat-trapping thermal shield
Thick material also provides UV protection
Attaches with side security panels and mirror straps for a dependable fit
cons: Mirror straps may not be long enough to fit all large trucks
fortunately it's not too difficult to use

customer_reviews.title: Thick fabric; fits CX-5 and Civic
customer_reviews.text: This feels to be durable material, maybe similar to 600-700 D Cordura. I tried it on a Maxda CX-5 2015 and a Honda Civic 2008 and it seems to fit them both. There is a flap on each side with a tube in it that you shut in your door, and an elastic band on each side to loop around the side mirror. It comes folded in a pouch of the same material. Have not tested it in snow yet, so will update later. UPDATE: 12/17 Well, tried it out a few days, and it works well. Saves time cleaning off the windows after work in the winter. See new pics.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Walker

customer_reviews.title: It can work in bad weather and stormy conditions
customer_reviews.text: It is perfact cover on 2018 camry,when I used in winter during snow fall and windy, it was not affected by weather.Even early morning I save my time.No need to clean snow from windshield and no screeching on windshield by snow remover.Actually I forget to write review so when I saw my history of order I got it.Perfect fitting on camry.

customer_reviews.title: Actually fits full size windshields and keep inside car cool from sun! Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than others I've tried. It even fits my full size car windshield, where most are too small... BUT IT DOES NOT fit a full size pickup, and the elastic breaks if you try to stretch it round the mirrors... The test now will be how it holds up in the wind and how long it lasts. From initial appearance I can tell it is made of better materials than any others I've tried... so here's hoping!!! Wish they made one to fit pickup trucks!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected--Do not scrape
customer_reviews.text: The windshield cover is much better than I expected. It is made from a heavy material and couldn't be any easier to use. We haven't had any snow yet, but we have had freezing rain and threats of freezing rain. I put the cover on my windshield and went inside without having to worry about an icy windshield in the morning. I'll be using this cover on my windshield all winter or until my carport arrives. This is a great tool for anybody that may have to leave their car outside. Not only does it protect your windshield from frozen precipitation, but also from falling sticks, nuts, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon D

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cover for my dodge caliber and it fits like a glove. If.my car was any bigger it wouldn't work. The 2 straps go around the side mirrorS and the 2 flaps get folded into the car and you shut the doors. This keeps the fabric nice and tight so the wind will not move it. It covers the wipers and the little space between the wipers and hood so ice and snow will not accumulate there either. I pulled it off after light snow last night and it just slid right off. I folded it and threw it in the back. Perfect for winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works as advertised. It totally blocks out the sun from coming into your automobile through the windshield. My car stays a lot cooler than using one that fits inside the windshield. I've only noticed a little bit of fading on the outside I don't expect dark black color to last very long, it's already faded quite a bit. The only change I wish they could make or offer is a silver color on the outside rather than black. Other than that I'm completely satisfied with it and I expect order another one for my other car.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a GMC Terrain recently and were originally looking for sun screens for the car. We found that the cheapest you could find for a quality product was around 40.00. While I was scrolling through products I came across this. I read the description and found that it works to keep frost/ice off the windshield as well as keeping the inside protected from the sun and cool. We decided to try this. Winter is not here yet, but it is working well as a sun screen and keeps the car cool. We are very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mia M Thurston

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. We don't have much snow here, but I have a pickup that sits out and the frost forms on the windshield every night. It has saved me a great deal of time from not having to scrape the window every morning. I looked a long time and finally ordered this product. It is excellent quality and I have installed it even in a high wind with no problems. I highly recommend this product, and the price is excellent as it is half the price of other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for both and and Frost! Keeps your windshield clean, I hightly recommend this product! Quick and easy to put on and take off!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, and it worked well for its purpose, but the side straps are not sewn in well, and it pulled apart on its first use. Not worth $30.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beam

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for use with wind
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product but if there is any kind of wind, the top piece blows away from the windshield allowing snow and ice to get in. I'm using it today in Northern Michigan for the first time and it's an epic fail. I would not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Witherbee

customer_reviews.title: Would’ve been perfect if it wouldn’t of slipped out from the windshield wipers
customer_reviews.text: That’s what a been perfect... Super easy to put on but when it’s windy it slips out from the windshield wipers. What a bummer I would’ve loved this because it was super easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: bryan cutter

customer_reviews.title: Works great and saves time and energy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and works great. No need to shovel or scrape the windshield after it snows. A little messy to store, so just have a plastic bag ready to put it in after use if there's no where to dry it out. So happy with this and wish I got it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Everest20

customer_reviews.title: Read Me For Free Beer!!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, no beer. Only an honest review. Do I have your attention? This thing is junk! Junk! Junk! This cover is supposed to fit trucks. I have a Tundra and this thing is way too small. It is too small length and height wise. The elastic that goes around the mirrors won’t stretch enough to even jury-rig the cover to fit over the center portion of the windshield. I am very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Measure your windshield
customer_reviews.text: Here's what the description says, ".....Sun Shade for Cars Trucks Vans and SUVs ...." Measure your windshield--don't go by the inflated description as to what this product will fit. Material seems good and easy to use BUT it has to fit to be useful. Buyer beware. Amazon allowed return so that is good. The measurement given on the website is the TOTAL length which includes the little flaps that go inside the door. Seller should post the "useable" area which is the area covering the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just wide enough for 2001 Ford F-150 truck, seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: KWBOY

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy! Poor Product.
customer_reviews.text: The strap broke the very first snow fall of the season. Strap around the mirror got very brittle and broke... poor product.
customer_reviews.author: Parag Pujari

customer_reviews.title: Keeps snow and dust off my windshield
customer_reviews.text: My car is in harsh weather when parked, from sun to snow. I wish now I'd had this item years ago. The fabric does fade in the sun somewhat but it protects and cools my car in sun and heat. It worked great during a snow storm and it was great not having to scrape off snow and ice and I did not need to run the heat to get the windshield clean. The only improvement and why I did not give it five stars is that I fear the elastic that goes around the side mirrors will not last long and that I'll need to replace those on my own. GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: ForLoveandGod

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This came in so handy this past winter and saved a lot of time trying to clear my car to get ready for work etc. Totally recommend getting it if you can't park in a garage or have your car outside in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Cat lover

customer_reviews.title: Pine sap be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I got one for a tiny 06 Honda Civic. Fits. Got the other for a big ole excursion that sits around too. Fits it too. Lol. These are GREAT! They are thick too. Not like those thin cheap ones that tear when a moth farts on them. These are perfect for keeping the pine sap off the windshields!
customer_reviews.author: Infandous Ktenology

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the top third easily flaps down so that only the lower part of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the top third easily flaps down so that only the lower part of windshield is protected. Also wish a carry bag was supplied as often have to fold it wet and store in trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Oze

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Toyota Highlander perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried it yet for the frost or snow but I can tell that it fits a Toyota Highlander perfectly. Read it in the questions somewhere where someone said it won’t. Not true. It fits.
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: Winter hell
customer_reviews.text: Love! Winter all five months of it 🙄 have been hell this year. After the third morning of finding my car encased in a shell of pure ice and almost being late to work because it took me half an hour to scrape my car out..... It's well worth the few minutes it takes to put this on. It's slightly annoying it gose over my mirrors that don't always like to cooperate and if I didn't pay " just right" you still get a very minor amount of frost underneath 💁 but overall I love it and it has saved me soooo much. Best buy this year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 for myself,1 for my granddaughter and 1 for a friend. We all love them and they fit the larger cars and Traverse well. As for putting the wet cover in your car, I bought a bucket at the dollar store and put it behind the driver's seat. I shake off the cover and fold it up to drain in the bucket. Your back seat or floor won't get wet and you don't have to open the trunk to put it in.
customer_reviews.author: J. CLARK

customer_reviews.title: Can only be used for smaller vehicles
customer_reviews.text: This windshield cover is definitely designed for smaller vehicles only. I own a VW Touareg SUV and the elastic that stretches over the mirror broke in the second use. Instructions for use we’re non-existent. The pictorial description also did not include the fact that you have to open the doors in order to put the flap inside the car, close the doors then put the elastic fastener around the mirror. I did like the fact it covered the entire windshield including the windshield wipers which is great. The construction materials of the cover were also top quality. Just substantial disappointment in the design of the elastic. Should’ve been offered in multiple sizes.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: OK for the price, but not as durable as I had hoped. Owned it just about exactly two years. It's used fairly frequently (but not daily) perhaps 3 months out of the year. We also don't use the elastic straps because they are mostly not totally needed and didn't want to risk breaking them. The cover works fine, but the fabric is starting to break down, almost like it's been left out in blazing sun -- which it hasn't. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I was hoping to get a few more years out of it considering the amount that it is in use. Not entirely sure we'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: MRO Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked really well on our "spare" Chrysler Town & Country van, that is a third car and sits in all kinds of weather. The only thing that keeps it from getting five stars is that it was hard to get around the side mirrors, so much so, that one tore away, I added a longer piece of elastic easy fix, and now it isn't as difficult to get over the side mirrors. It is a BIG windshield so with a regular car, I'm sure it would work fine without modification. We live in Iowa, so it's been nice not to have to scrape the windshield!
customer_reviews.author: PatiIowa

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for any car
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I have ever bought! Bought this for 3 different cars (mini, mazda, and Subaru) and works amazingly well on all 3. Protected each recently in an ice storm and snow.
customer_reviews.author: T. MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: Terrific invention
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't the guy who invented the ice scraper invent this first? This is a great idea, easy to use, does exactly what I need, keep my windshield free of ice and snow. My truck is parked outside all the time, cold and icy mornings are a challenge. Had to fire up the truck, heater/defroster on high and just wait. Now I can simply pull this thing off, put it back in its bag for the day and I'm good to go. Should be good for hot days to keep the sun out while it's parked.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for north country...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this product years ago. I live in northern NE and I tried it the other morning. All the cars around me had frost on the windshield except for mine. It was a fabulous morning. I didn’t have to scrape my windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice protection
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice cover to help reduce the heat onto your dash or the inside of your vehicle. It takes only a few seconds on each side of the car to install. My only complaint is that the outside of the cover faded pretty quickly in the sun. I did not take any off on the rating since I believe it still performs its job. I have yet to use this with snow so I will be back later this year to update my review. If the cost was a little bit less, I might have purchased a few more for my other vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: stkyrce

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Total crap!!! I just removed this of of my windshield, and I mean just now. The elastic straps broke. There is no magnets or anything to keep snow from falling down in between this "cover" and your windshield. Really disappointed since I live in the upper midwest. This was my first time use and it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Henslin

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't held up in Vermont winter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product about 2-3 months ago. I have been using it daily. Last week, I went out to take the cover off and found it had two tears . I am very disappointed! Also rain and snow would get down under the cover at times and then would freeze on windshield. I did install it as directions and video showed but still had problems. Also rain got in through where the window flap was placed on the window door and soaked my passenger side seat. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: eileen cTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived in tack and on time. I wasn't sure if this would work in windy weather either but it absolutely works! It was really easy to install and the added seal on the interior side really stood up to the wind. I had a different model that completely drenched the inside of my car. So far I have used it for rain, sleet but not snow yet. I usually park in a garage, but got this for when I head out to work or if I decide to leave it out. I would buy this again and would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Haney

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: It works good. Def keeps the snow off the window like it says. I was all about getting this thing to try it out but Personally to me it's a waste of money and more work especially if you are a who likes to warm ur car in the winter anyway. To me it's just easier to warm my car nd not have to worry about putting this thing on at night nd taking it off in The morning.
customer_reviews.author: A.moy6911

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but doesn’t fit larger SUVs and trucks
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea but doesn’t fit larger SUVs and trucks. Tried it on 2018 Chevy Tahoe and King Ranch truck. Elastic needs to be longer to loop around mirrors. Mirrors in does not help either. The solution? I bought 1 inch black elastic from the craft store and made another loop in the sewn in loop. The flap at the bottom near wipers does get blown upward with wind exposing the glass. You could put wipers over top to hold down, but then it defeats the purpose of avoiding the snow. Good idea, just needs better adjustments for or have different sizes for all vehicles .
customer_reviews.author: Hello!

customer_reviews.title: Worked even better that hoped-for
customer_reviews.text: I put the cover on hours before we got 4 inches of wet heavy snow topped with sleet. After the snow and sleet ended, the winds kicked up to over 30 m.p.h. for a number of hours. The cover stayed in place perfectly, and came off easily. Note when you put it on that the elastic stretches around the side mirrors. The flaps don't cover the side mirrors. They go inside the doors - close the door over them - to hold the upper part of the cover in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh this thing has made my life better! I now pull this off(I put the flaps ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh this thing has made my life better! I now pull this off(I put the flaps in the car door to keep it from folding down and ending up with half a windshild of ice), fold it, throw it in the trunk and scrape the rear window if needed then go.
customer_reviews.author: Martinez

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay
customer_reviews.text: Having one of these sounds good in theory, but ends up not being as practical as expected. It is annoying to put on and take off every time you get in/out of your car, so I end up only putting it on sometimes. When I do have it on, it does a good job of keeping the snow off my windshield. However, it's useless if there is wind. The wind will lift the flaps up from the bottom, allowing for snow and ice to get on your windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Winter Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered for my husbands Tacoma and it fit perfectly and easy to attach. I gave it a 4 star rating because we have only used it a few days. But, so far he loves it because he doesn't have to scrape the windows. or wait for the defroster to clear. It fits well over the windshield and covers the wiper area. We have some very high winds here, so waiting to see how it holds up. If it proves to hold up this winter I'll give it a five star.
customer_reviews.author: Main-iac

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant and since I work night shift on call thought would it be worth it? It is absolute look y perfect. I was impressed light weight easily handled and I am 5 ft 4 inches with an SUV and it is easy to put on as it simply fits inside the doors when you close them, and an elastic strap loops around the side mirrors Then you are done - come back 12 hrs later after snow and ICU rain and remove it easily and you have a perfec perfect windshield view no scraping or frozen fingers shivering in the cold. Simple yet true value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: N. Basile

customer_reviews.title: Fits an Extra Large Windshield
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it! He couldn't wait to try it. It snowed on cue. It worked well on the very large windshield of his truck, however we learned that it must be in place before wet weather begins or it will actually freeze to the windshield. We used it twice. The second time it was wet when we put it on the windshield and it froze in place. That was interesting...lesson learned. Other than that, it was perfect. Very large. Has straps to hold it on place. It also comes with a nice pouch for storage. Let it dry completely before storing.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Versitile Size
customer_reviews.text: We had a different windshield cover for my wife's car which started to fall apart. I decided on this one based on reviews and the description on Amazon. It turns out that it's quite a nice cover. Although it is a little over-sized for her car, it means that this cover can work on a wide range of vehicles. The material is strong, too, and remains supple even in very cold temperatures and with snow and ice. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JPfromOH

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this windshield cover! I have a 2011 Ford Escape and it fits the windshield perfectly. I use it every night after work, even if there is no snow predicted, simply for the fact that frost happens, and it saves me those extra couple minutes in the morning. I just undo the straps around the side-view mirrors, pull the cover off, and boom, ready to go! I highly recommend this cover to anyone and have already told multiple friends/family members about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go by description
customer_reviews.text: Not a hail protector as shown in description Adding an additional sleeping bag helps protect from hail. It cracked my windshield on the edges. underneath the cover helps protect against hail storm. You can get products like these for 1/3dd the price ($10)
customer_reviews.author: adi

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept. Some practical limitations to be aware of.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is to cover your car's top so that snow piles on that as opposed to the car itself. The problem is where to put this material AFTER it has been removed and has a lot of snow on it. You are supposed to shake the snow off and then put it where in the car? If you are at home when it snows and you have no garage, then it is useful. If you are parked on the street away from home then it is not too useful.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent traveller

customer_reviews.title: Windshield cover works but elastics broke off first time without much force
customer_reviews.text: Did it work? Yes. My windshield wasn’t covered in ice or snow which made it a lot quicker to clean my car. Did BOTH the elastic bands IMMEDIATELY break as soon as I took it off the first time? Yes. Both immediately ripped off when I was only trying to take them off of the mirrors, trying carefully to not break it off because I figured the cold would cause issues. I’m still gonna use it because it locks in the car but annoyed about the elastics. Would have done better with a tie system for the mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent solution for avoiding scraping ice and snow in the morning!
customer_reviews.text: I have to park my vehicle outdoors (rather than in a garage) overnight and sometimes it's a real pain when I'm in a hurry and find that it snowed or iced up overnight. This windshield cover keeps the windshield dry and the wipers free from ice too! Highly recommended! I drive a Honda Odyssey so it doesn't fit perfectly across the windshield (a little small) but it covers enough and serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Rosann Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: NO fit if you have 2009 Ford F150
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2009 Ford f150 and it does NOT fit as promised! Do not buy this product if you have this truck...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a lifesaver in the snow!
customer_reviews.text: First? I could see the looks from my neighbors like what on earth is she doing? Then? After a night of snowfall and everyone out in the morning trying to leave I am the one just pulling this off the windshield and ready to go much faster than those with scrapers and brushes. Works well when it has been a freezing rain also. Keep in mind if it has ice on it and you throw it in the car that it is going to melt everywhere... but if you are needing to deal with winter weather? You should know that already.
customer_reviews.author: California Faye

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. Fits car well, works well. My only reason for 4 stars, would be if it had a little bit of a magnetic strip on the top. If wind blows the top part will fold down a bit and not cover the windshield, which happens if there is wind and then snows or just on a windy night with temps below freezing. Otherwise, it works great and the material feels like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: BASIC TARP with SIDE MIRROR LOOPS
customer_reviews.text: BASIC TARP with SIDE MIRROR LOOPS ... I bought this primarily for the side mirror loops and had THOUGHT THIS WAS A HEAVIER tarp -- WRONG !!! This is NOT any heavier then other windshield tarps I've bought and DON'T BELIEVE the SELLER'S VIDEO HYPE for it being better. I appreciate the side mirror loops for security but I really wanted a Heavier tarp in the first place. (This is NOT that)
customer_reviews.author: DAVID STRONG

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: When I put it on, I didn’t need it. When I needed it, I forgot to put it on. Even when I remembered to put it on, snow and ice still got underneath even though I had it on correctly. Removing it from the windshield and shaking off the snow, doesn’t leave you with a dry cover, so you have to throw it in the car wet. When I had it on and it rained, then the temp dropped below freezing, the cover froze to my windshield and I had to scrape it off. This product just isn’t worth it, haven’t used it since.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S Dayton

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 17 year old daughter because we don't let her park in the garage. She needs to know the pain of winter and parking outside (but we're trying to be nice on the windshield part because she is not a morning person). She said it is the greatest thing, as she has had to deal with window scraping prior. She said she just throws it in the back seat and does not think she could ever fold it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Welcome

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: My defroster quit working just as the winter season was coming in. In Missouri the weather is extremely unpredictable, so not having a working defroster in the early morning is a huge problem. I decided to buy one of these to see if it would help keep the frost and ice off my windshield so that I could get to work without having my windshield fogging up on me while driving, and I was extremely satisfied within just the first few days. I used it everyday throughout winter, and I never had a single problem! It kept me from having to scrape my windshield as well! Huge Time Saver! I would definitely recommend this windshield cover to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: JaimeD

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this a couple times and it has worked. Covers my wiper blades. Have to open each car door to put flaps in but that’s expected for theft and securement. Only negative is the elements are still on the visor after removal. Just have to lay it out to dry. Helps save time brushing or scraping off ice. Worth the buy. Already got 2 others going to buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: Fits large and small vehicles
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure if this cover would fit both of the vehicles that I want to use it on. So I ordered one and put it on our 2015 Ford Explorer. It was a bit of a stretch but it fit. The I tried it on our other vehicle, a 2011 Audi A5. It fit that as well. The flaps that are held in place by the window when you when you shut the door seem adequate to keep the cover in place when it is windy. I ordered a second one so that we can cover both vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Starch

customer_reviews.title: Spotless windshield after 4+ inches of snow
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! Unfortunately, it was a heavy downpour prior to the heavy snowfall of 4 inches overnight. One side is a thin canvas-like material and the other is plastic. The canvas side got a bit wet but the plastic was completely dry. Peeled away with ease and cut the brushing time in half! Not a single flake of snow touched my windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Chrysler minivan
customer_reviews.text: This fits a Chrysler town and country, although the elastic barely fits over the mirrors, stretched to the max. So of course it ripped off one side- this minus a star. But the weighted tabs that fit inside the doors hold it pretty well, and I just tucked the loose strap inside the door as well. It has held up for a few weeks of ice and snow almost nightly. Regular light snow shakes right off. If it’s icy and snowy I hang it inside during the day. It’s heavy rubberized canvas. Fabric is fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my SUV
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2008 Toyota Highlander SUV and this fit great. I used it when i got home and it had already been snowing. It did freeze a little bit to the windshield but not too bad (and not unexpected since there was already snow on the car when i put it on). It was so great to not have to scrape all this snow/ice off! It did snow a bit more than in the 1st picture. Probably about 4 inches on it when i took it off. Now i just need to remember to look at the forecast before going to bed so i can remember to put it on!
customer_reviews.author: windie809

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on a truck.
customer_reviews.text: NOT good for a truck. The strap broke and the cover ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Short

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I had another type of windshield cover which broke so I got this one. It's better quality and I'm not sure there's any way this would break. It folds pretty easy into it's bag as well. I like how it has "flaps" on the sides which get pinched in the doors and extra elastic straps which wrap around the side mirrors. I've used it with bad weather (wind/snow) and it stayed in place. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barajas

customer_reviews.title: 100% as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Currently in use in Alaska. It does exactly what it’s advertised to do. The rest of the car can be nothing but frost and when you remove this the windshield is crystal clear. I was skeptical at first, but I’m sold on this device. If there is a downside it’s that you have to put it somewhere when you take it off, and wherever you decide that is is where the frost on the outside of the cover melts. An excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Bit tight to get on my SUV
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure just saying fits SUV's is enough info. My SUV is full size and I walked back and forth far too many times trying to get it to reach both sides of my vehicle. I did get it on but then... I was afraid I'd break the straps removing it. 2 suggestion ... state if the SUV is "full size or crossover's"... and make the straps that loop it to the vehicle adjustable so we can put it on and adjust the snugness onto the windshield.. It did keep my windshield covered nicely..
customer_reviews.author: Nancy of NJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s a fine product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’d been looking for a windshield cover for my Volvo S70. I didn’t want magnets or any tie down straps other than ones that attached around the mirrors. So far it’s done a great job preventing the early season frost from building on my windshield. Hasn’t snowed yet. It’s a perfect fit. The bottom of the cover completely conceals the wipers. So bottom line. It’s as good as it gets!! Paul
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: First off I can confirm that this cover fits a 2014 Ford Escape perfectly. The quality is good and it feels like it will last a while unlike many cheaper covers. I like the idea of having the anti theft wings that fit inside the door too. All in all this is a quality cover and the design has been well thought out, so I have no problem recommending this to anyone who needs a windshield cover for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Walker

customer_reviews.title: A godsend!
customer_reviews.text: We had a snowstorm every other day in February of this year. I love how easy this was to put on and take off when my vehicle had to sit outside. This is NE Wisconsin and I don't know how I did with out this product all of my life! Really worth the money. I loved to not have to scrape my windows off and not having my windshield wipers all full of ice. Another fantastic product I would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: flowerlvr

customer_reviews.title: Good Price/ Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fairly heavy material, won't blow off around the edges, like other thinner covers. Wish it was a couple inches longer& wider to fit the Van windshield better. The car has a big windshield with deep slots for wipers & it seems to prevent that deep wiper slot from filling up with ice/snow. We'll see as winter is just beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Gold

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate not scraping ice off my windshield in the morning.
customer_reviews.text: The weather in my area is at the lowest around 27°F/-2 C, and this has been effective. It fits my compact size car well. It has a canvas texture on the outside but it primarily plastic, and is a medium-light weight, it seems pretty durable. It has an elastic tie to hold it to the mirror, also the flaps on the side that I believe tuck into the car doors have a cushion sewn on the end, which would prevent someone from pulling the cover out and stealing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Woodside

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement. Way too small.
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned by others, it doesn’t fit the current Tundra truck body & I doubt it would fit any truck. See pics - it’s not even close to being long enough to wrap around the mirrors. It’s unethical & misleading for the seller to repeatedly advertise that it fits all vehicles, so it’s a 1 start for me, regardless of product quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Two obvious problems. One problem I had was ice sticking to the cover. Luckily I had a plastic tub for the cover so the melting ice didn't cause puddles inside the car. The other problem is the windshield should be relative clear of snow and ice before putting the cover on. Otherwise, in severe weather, the snow or ice will still be on the windshield when you take off the cover. The bottom line though is that the cover saved me a lot of scraping in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: HowardK

customer_reviews.title: Windshield shade
customer_reviews.text: We live in Houston...hotter than heck here...I need a good sun shade but more than that I need something to keep aphid spit off the windshield...my car sits under an oak tree in our driveway. Good sturdy fabric with a rubber under side...fits a Chevy equinox perfect...order the standard size. It’s a good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: JanT

customer_reviews.title: The part by the top of the windshield flys down in strong wind
customer_reviews.text: This works really well.. so long as there isn't a strong wind blowing from behind your car. It folds over on itself and only covers the bottom half of your windshield. It's still worth it to me since it works most times.
customer_reviews.author: Z7

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product and keeps the elements off the windshield and wiper blades. No more defrosting on those winter mornings. I can't wait to see how it works in the summer with keeping the heat from the sun coming thru the windsheild and heating up my leather seats. Love the product overall and it does it's job as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works well in KS
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the snow and ice off my windshield like a champ. I live in Kansas, so it saw its fair share of ice and snow last winter. I found that the bottom of the cover has a tendency to flip up a bit in the wind, which may just be due to the shape/angle of my windshield (Volvo s60). I put my wipers over it to hold it down. They're easier to unstick from the cover than from the windshield itself. Overall, I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Elantra nicely and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Elantra nicely and easy to install. I just received this a couple day ago and there is snow in the forecast. I am anxious to see how nice it will be to just remove the cover and not have to scrape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: You know what I don't love about living in the mountains? The amount of time I spend cleaning off my windshield every year. I'm pretty sure if I were to add up all the time I take cleaning the snow off my windshield; it would equal about a month every single year. I HATE IT. This product is the sh*t because I don't have to do it anymore. My boyfriend also loves it because he doesn't have to actually go clean the snow off my car because lets be honest, he's the one doing it most of the time. We love this. Buy it. You won't regret this. Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgid O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: saves me from scraping ice
customer_reviews.text: It has been cold here in the PNW and I hate having to scrap or melt the ice or frost on my windshields, especially in the morning when I am trying to go to work or something. This has helped to prevent me from standing outside scraping at the windshield. If only I can remember to put it on after work or in the evening! Highly recommend the product if your car is outside in a cold area!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Shop around
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke 1st time using it. Not a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: roger donald eggert

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit large trucks
customer_reviews.text: We have a later model Ford F-150 and it didn't quite cover the windshield. The side straps did not stretch enough to get around the side mirrors and the seam broke when trying to install. The cover itself was difficult to pull and keep tight because of the short ends that would be held by the doors. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: SommMom

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this. My first Montana winter has improved greatly by not having to scrape ice off my windshield every morning. It fits perfectly and is extremely easy to put on. If you have snowy/icy winters, I'd highly recommend you get this. I'm going to give it a try this summer to see if it keeps my steering wheel from scalding my hands in the hot afternoons.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Vehicle Sunshade
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Just need 1 of these and it totally work to keep Sun out of front windshield, it really keeps our heat off of the car from the inside, just ordered another 1 for our other truck. Both vehicles gets really hot with no shade by Sunny skies. Definitely worked.
customer_reviews.author: Hot$hot5

customer_reviews.title: If you live where it snows, this is a must!
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver if you live in a snowy climate. Avoid scraping. I highly recommend. However warning. I had a small chip in my windscreen. It snowed overnight and I left the cover on, and the temperature was high the following day. The black PVC made the crack spread ... from cold to hot temps, so don't leave on if high temperature fluctuations in 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Marie Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Tesla Model 3
customer_reviews.text: The Tesla model 3 does not allow for the wipers to be left standing up to prevent them from freezing onto the windshield. This cover solves that problem. I make sure it covers the wiper well and it fits snuggly. Snow shakes off very easily, but ice still sticks to it (matte side) and it took some work to get it off, but off it went. All in all very happy with this cover.
customer_reviews.author: J. Buenfil

customer_reviews.title: Elastic Broke Within 1st Week
customer_reviews.text: Used it as expected on the car outside overnight, next morning went to take it off - elastic broke.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gayther

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY IT !!!
customer_reviews.text: This cover saved me a many of cold and icy morning. I don’t care to wake up earlier than I have to, to defrost and remove Snow from my car. This product not only saves me time but comes in handy. All my neighbors wanted to know why I was covering my car by the morning we had snow and while they were cleaning off their car I was on my way to work. Needless to say this product does it job.
customer_reviews.author: Shanice

customer_reviews.title: No more stretching to try to reach the windshield!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who parks outside and lives where there’s snow and ice needs this! This is now a must have in my life. It’s so easy, you walk out pull it off fold it up put it in the trunk and go to work. No more having to scrape and scrape and scrape and try to reach the center of the windshield. This is perfect on my Hyundai Santa Fe!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and frustrations
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! As someone who works nights, this is a frustration saver! Pictures were of first nights use. A chilly 26* and still a clear windshield was waiting for me after my shift. Couldn't ask for a better result. The material is nice & heavy. Fits well in my large 06 Jeep Grand Cherokee window, with room to spare. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: It fits my 2012 and 2015 Camry well, nearly OEM. It is elegant and simple to put in place compared to some competitors. Also it isn't too big and poofy like some others. It does not have straps. It may not stay in place during high winds. I cannot attest to performance because we've yet to be blessed with ice or snow. I will update the review later.
customer_reviews.author: Dad's Garage

customer_reviews.title: Toooo small. Now I'm beat
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift. My brother has a pickup. Was supposed to fit but it is way too small. Past return time they say but this is first bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: Carolann

customer_reviews.title: Fits nice on a 2018 Subaru Crosstrek
customer_reviews.text: Not quite using this as intended but I am very pleased. We have a terrible Spotted Lantern Fly problem where I live and they leave a sticky residue called honeydew on my windshield that my wipers and washer fluid can't clean. I am using this cover to keep my windshield clean so I dont have to spray and wipe every time I leave my house. Also works great at helping to keep my interior cooler. I was worried that the rain would come in my car through the parts that go in your car door but it does not. Looking forward to using it to keep my windshield clear of fallen leaves, frost and snow in the coming months!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great IF
customer_reviews.text: you get it on your car BEFORE it snows :) So, these items (and there are many different brands) are great in theory. Otherwise, if it's already snowing when you get to work and you don't want to scrape or unbury your windshield at the end of the day, it's a pain to get this on without trapping snow/ice underneath. I've used it twice and was happy with it, but I knew the snow was coming before it arrived so it was easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is our third purchase of this item. The quality is great and the size just right for our Dodge van and also our pickups. The recent purchase came with a nice storage bag, however, we did not receive bags with the previous two, which we bought about a year ago. Was that a shipping error? Would the seller be kind enough to send us bags to go with our previous two purchases?
customer_reviews.author: Cha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Cool gadget for protecting my windshield from all the snow and ice we get up north. It's a little tedious to go and walk around to put the flaps in and out of your car doors, but I like it for theft protection and the wind recently would have ripped it right off if it wasn't. When I remember to put it on, it's great coming out to when trying to get to work because then it's one less thing I have to do to get to work. I liked it enough to buy my mom one too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he likes it so much that I just ordered one for me too! Sure could have used it today!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great timesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for me this winter! I haven’t used my ice scraper once, and my wrists are so grateful! It took me a few tries to figure out how to use it — were instructions included and I lost mine? I never saw them. But once I figured out that those weighted flaps go inside the doors, instead of covering the side windows, it’s been easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Matelli

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Helpful in These Northern Winters
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for nearly a couple of winters now. It's been a big help. It shaves off at least a minute of preparing the car for a drive. It's great to clear off the windshield by just removing a big piece of cloth. A tiny amount of frost usually still forms since the cover isn't airtight, but it's never enough to worry about. I've used the cover about 20 times now and there is no sign of wear or tear. Putting it on and taking it off is a breeze. All in all, it's a purchase I'm very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Sam T.

customer_reviews.title: A Winter must have
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't have one of these before? After the second snow storm here in UT, I got sick of brushing and scraping, I bought this one based on the ratings. I don't think its a show-stopper that it doesn't cover the mirrors, and it's a perfect fit on a 2019 VW GTi.
customer_reviews.author: B1R

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality: a rip-off
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in November 2018. Used it about 10 times during winter 2018/19 and once during November 2019. The strap around the side mirror broke even though the product was less than 1 year old. The warranty was for 1 month. A rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my daughter. She lives in an apartment complex with no garage. I got this for her to save time in the morning, which is 4 am. She said it went on fast and came off just as fast. She was also a little worried about ice in the morning under it, but when it came off, NO ICE!!!! She loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

product_meta.title: OxGord Windshield Snow Cover Ice Removal Wiper Visor Protector All Weather Winter Summer Auto Sun Shade for Cars Trucks Vans and SUVs Stop Scraping with a Brush or Shovel
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: 75”L x 0.1”W x 42.25”H inches - All-weather winter windshield guard provides full coverage – Windshield cover canvases the entirety of your windshield and fits most cars, trucks, vans, and SUV’s - To ensure proper fitment, please take an accurate measurement of your windshield
ULTIMATE WINTER PROTECTION: Constructed from thick durable heavy-duty 600D polyester - Protects from snow, ice, rain, sleet, slush, water, hail, snowstorms as well as other winter debris & weather

FROST GUARD: Thermal shield traps heat ensuring an ice and snow-free windshield every morning, day, and night - This will leave the front windshield clean & clear, which will improve visibility and increase safety while on the road
EASY TO SECURE: Quick installation – No tools required – Requires use of both front doors and side view mirrors - PLEASE NOTE this item DOES NOT use magnets or suction cups
ANTI THEFT: Side panels close inside the front car doors to help prevent and deter thieves from stealing the windshield protector and from being blown away by the wind

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,314 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
